alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, western Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, New Kent, east central Henrico, southeastern Hanover, southern King William and south central Lancaster Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near King And Queen Court House, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Kent, King William, West Point, Urbanna, Talleysville, King And Queen Court House, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Tunstall, Manquin, Church View, Bottoms Bridge, Saluda, Studley, Glenns, Jamaica, Little Plymouth, Shacklefords, Eltham and Cohoke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Western King William
